gamenews.headline: Prey Creatures
gamenews.message:
Activate a prey to gain a bonus when hunting certain monsters!
 

Press to open the prey dialog.

 

 

(1) You can also click the prey button to open the prey window in your sidebar.

(2) Left-click in the prey window to open the prey dialog.

Select your prey or click here if you want to reroll the monsters to choose from:

 

You get a free list reroll every 20 hours. The gold price for a list reroll depends on your character level.

 

 

 

Once you have selected your prey, click here to activate it and get a random bonus: damage boost, damage reduction, bonus XP, or improved loot.

 

If you are looking for a specific monster, you can use five Prey Wildcards to directly select the prey of your choice.

 

 

Use a Prey Wildcard to reroll your bonus to get one with a higher value.
Prey Wildcards can be purchased for Tibia Coins in the Store or can be obtained at the reward shrine. 

 


You want a different prey but would like to keep your current bonus?

Roll for a new monster list while you already have an active prey. Select a new prey from the list and activate it. Your hunting time will be reset to 2 hours.

 

 

Tick the option "Automatic Bonus Reroll" if you want to have your prey bonus rerolled automatically whenever it is about to expire. Please note that each Automatic Bonus Reroll consumes one of the Prey Wildcards you have bought in the Store.

 


You want a different bonus but would like to keep your current prey?

Roll for a new bonus while you already have an active prey. Your hunting time will be reset to 2 hours with your new bonus.

 

 

You have found your perfect prey and bonus combination? Tick the option "Lock Prey" and your prey time will be set back whenever it is about to expire. Please note that each time the Lock Prey option triggers, it will consume five of your Prey Wildcards.

 

 

 

 


The prey window shows your current prey, your bonus and the remaining time for the prey.
Hover over your prey for a tooltip with details.

 

By the way: Prey time only decreases while hunting!

 

You can activate up to 3 preys simultaneously.
All players can use the first prey slot, Premium players can also use the second slot. Additional prey slots can be unlocked permanently by purchasing them for Tibia Coins in the Store.

gamenews.headline: Loyalty System
gamenews.message:
Being a loyal premium player grants you additional rewards.

Every already used premium day on your account equals one loyalty point. You can check your loyalty points on your account page under General Information.

 Depending on the number of loyalty points on your account, you may receive an honourable title, appear in the loyalty highscores or even enjoy a bonus of up to 50% on your skill points.

 

If you have earned yourself a place in the loyalty highscores, you can select which of your characters should be displayed there.

Click on your account page to open your account management.

Click on Loyalty Highscore Character in the navigation bar or scroll down to the respective section.

Select the character of your choice via the dropdown menu. You can only select characters that are not hidden.

You will appear in the loyalty highscores of the game world your selected character belongs to.

The manual on our website provides you with more details about the loyalty system, including a list of all titles you can earn and an example of how the skill bonus exactly works.

gamenews.headline: Need Help?
gamenews.message:
A wealth of information is available to help you find your way around in Tibia.

Hover your mouse cursor over a button or a bar in the client interface to have a tooltip appear.

Turn your mouse cursor into a magnifying glass by pressing

Now hover over certain elements of the client to get additional information displayed.

 

You can also select the Help tab in the Options menu to get ingame help or to access specific help sections of the Tibia website.

The Get Help section on our website provides you with useful links to various topics related to the game itself and your account.

gamenews.headline: The Store
gamenews.message:
The Store offers a wide range of Tibia products that you can buy without having to leave the game.
Purchases are made with Tibia Coins, a special currency in Tibia.

Click on this button below your inventory to open the Store.

You can check you current balance of Tibia Coins here:

 
Tibia Coins can be bought in our Webshop. Click this button to open the Tibia website in a browser window and log in to access the Webshop.

You can also buy Tibia Coins from other players ingame via the Market.

Click on a category to see the products within it. Some categories have subcategories (indicated by a small arrow) for easier navigation.

 

 

 

 

 

If a product and its Buy button are greyed out, the product is currently not available for your character. Hover of the Buy button to find out why. 

Please note that products which cannot be used by your character at all, e.g. due to a vocation restriction, will not be displayed. 


 

(1) In some categories, you are able to filter products further by clicking on "Show All" and selecting the filter of your choice.
(2) You can also change the display order of products via the right dropdown menu.


You can also use the search function in the Store if you are looking for specific products.

 

 

To buy something, select the product of your choice and click the Buy button. Confirm your purchase by clicking Buy in the next window.

 Check the box "Do not show this dialog again!" if you want to buy products instantly without any confirmation. 

You can also change this setting via the General Options menu.

 

After a purchase, click this box to open it and close the window to continue.

Portable items you have bought in the Store (e.g. potions) will be sent to your Store inbox.
You can open the Store inbox wherever you are.

Items purchased in the Store can only be used by the character that purchased them.

Pieces of furniture or decoration bought in the Store can only be unwrapped in a house owned by this character.


You can also use the Store to gift Tibia Coins to other accounts.
You can only gift transferable Tibia Coins.


Click History to see a history all of your Tibia Coins transactions.

Curious how a certain outfit or mount would look on your character?

Select the mount or outfit of your choice and click the "Try On" button to open a preview dialog. Here, you can try out various combinations of outfits and mounts.

You can also rotate your character in the preview window to see it from different sides and you can preview walking or riding animations.

Please note that any settings or combinations you select via the "Try Outfit" dialog will neither be saved nor trigger a purchase.

If you want to buy an outfit or mount you need to click the "Buy" button in the Store.

 
If you want to actually change your character outfit, its colours or your mount ingame, use the "Set Outfit" dialog.

gamenews.headline: Hotkeys
gamenews.message:
Hotkeys allow you to quickly trigger actions by pressing a specific key or key combination.
Define hotkey presets for your characters to optimise your gameplay!

You can have the hotkey preset for a specific character automatically activated upon login.

Press or open the Options menu and go to the Hotkeys section. Check this box:

Either click Add to create a new hotkey preset or Rename to change the name an existing one.

Make sure to name the hotkey preset exactly like the character it is meant for and click OK. Done!

 
There are two chat modes in Tibia. This is important to know for your hotkey presets.

Chat On

You can write text in the chat console.

If you have assigned an action to a letter key (e.g. A), pressing this key will trigger the action but you will not be able to type the letter in the entry line of the chat console.

Chat Off

You cannot write any text in the entry line of the console.

Per default, you can walk with WASD in this mode.

Chat On*

This temporary mode is a special case. Per default, if you press the Return key in Chat Off mode, it temporarily switches to Chat On* so that you can write one message in the console. As soon as you press Return to send the message, your chat mode will be set to Chat Off again.
The small button on the right side of the entry line of the chat console tells you which chat mode is currently active. Click it to switch between the two chat modes.

To assign and edit hotkeys, first select the hotkey preset you want to edit.

Now select the chat mode for which you want to edit hotkeys:

 


If you want your hotkeys to work in both modes, you need to set them in both modes!
So this basically means that you have to set up your hotkeys twice.

 

Check the box Show Advanced Options to access all hotkeys via the three hotkey subsections under Controls: general hotkeys, action bar hotkeys and custom hotkeys.

If you leave the box unchecked, only basic options will be displayed in the Options menu. With this setting, you can only assign hotkeys to predefined actions via the button Hotkeys: 


If you have checked the box Show Advanced Options,
you can set your personal hotkeys in the subsection Custom Hotkeys.

Let's create a new entry:

Click on New Action and select the action of your choice.

 

(1) Click on Assign Spell to open a small window listing the various spells. Select a spell.

(2) Click OK to close this window.

 

If you select Assign Object, your mouse cursor will turn into a crosshair. Click on an item and choose your preferred action in the window that will pop up.

Click OK to close this window.

(1) Click on Assign Text to open a small window and enter your text message.

(2) Click OK to close this window. If you want to send the text right away when clicking the action button, select send automatically before hitting OK.

Now we need to actually assign a hotkey to the action we just selected:

(1) To do so, click on the small pencil icon in the field First Key. This will open a window where you can edit the hotkey. 

(2) Press the key or key combination of your choice.

(3) Click OK to close this window.

 

  


You can assign up to 2 hotkeys to every action. You need to have a hotkey assigned in the column First Key to be able to assign a hotkey in the column Second Key.

Always remember to save your hotkey changes and settings before closing the hotkey dialog!
To do so you can either click Apply to save your changes or click OK to save your changes and close the dialog.

 

If you are looking for a specific hotkey in a hotkey section, you can also use the search bar.

 

How to assign a hotkey to toggle between Chat On an Off:

  • Set hotkey preset for chat mode to Chat Off, scroll to the predefined action Chat Mode: Set to Chat On. Assign the hotkey of your choice.
  • Set hotkey preset for chat mode to Chat On, scroll to the predefined action Chat Mode: Set to Chat Off. Assign the same hotkey.
  • Click Apply to save or OK to save and close the hotkey dialog. Pressing this hotkey now toggles between the chat modes.

gamenews.headline: Webshop
gamenews.message:
In the Tibia Webshop you can order Premium Time, Tibia Coins or Extra Services for your account. Various payment methods are available for your purchases.
 

Click on your account page to open your account management.

Use the navigation bar or scroll down to go to the section Products Available from where you can access the Tibia Webshop or redeem a game code.

 

Click one of these three buttons to open the respective section of the Webshop:

 

If no country is preselected or to change the selected country, please use the drop-down menu. All prices are shown in the currency of the country you have selected.

 

(1) Click on one of the tabs to navigate through the Webshop and check which products are available.

(2) Select the product you would like to purchase by clicking on it.

Now you can see all payment methods you can use to purchase this product.

The price for the product you have selected may vary depending on the payment method you choose.

Click Next to proceed once you have selected the product and payment method of your choice.

 You will now be asked to enter payment data depending on the payment method you selected. Hover over the question marks to get additional info about the data you need to enter.

Click Next to proceed to the confirmation page.
All data you entered will be shown so please check it thoroughly.

(1) If everything has been entered correctly, check this box to accept the Extended Tibia Service Agreement and the Tibia Privacy Policy.

(2) When you are ready to submit your order, click Buy Now.

On the last page, you will receive a summary of your order and see whether or not your order was successful. Depending on the payment method you chose, you may also be provided with further instructions on how to complete your order (e.g. payment details for bank transfers, redirection to payment providers).

 

You bought a game code from one of our official resellers? Click the button Use Game Code in the section Products Available on your account management page to redeem it.

(1) Enter the 20-digit code. Make sure to enter all letters and numbers correctly.

(2) Click Next to proceed. If you have entered a valid and correct game code, the code will be shown to you once more on the next page together with the service for which the game code is valid. If everything is correct, click Next again to activate the code.

gamenews.headline: Quick Looting
gamenews.message:
Use quick looting to loot more efficiently and customise it to your liking.
 

Quick looting allows you to loot all items in a monster corpse with a single click.

If you use Classic Controls, you can choose between the following mouse options to quick loot:

 

 

If you use Left Smart-Click, you quick loot all items if you press Alt + left click on a corpse.

If you use Regular Controls, you quick loot all items if you press Shift + right click on a corpse.
   

As a premium player, you can also loot a specific item within a corpse with a single click:

 

Classic Controls Left Smart-Click Regular Controls

If you use the animated mouse cursor, a special icon will indicate quick looting. You can activate this cursor in the Options menu.

 

If you tick off the option Show Loot Highlighting under Game Window in the Options menu, unlooted corpses will be visually highlighted.

The effect disappears as soon as any player eligible for loot either a) opens the corpse, b) quick-loots the corpse or c) the corpse expires. The highlight does not appear for empty corpses, player corpses and cooperative loot from bosses.


Premium status allows you to refine quick looting with two filters: Skipped Loot and Accepted Loot.
While you can only use one of the two filters at a time, you can switch between the two of them as you please.

Here's how you set them up:

Open the Manage Containers dialog.
You can access it via the Cyclopedia, the context menu of a container or a hotkey which you can assign in the Hotkey section of the Options menu.

 

Choose Skipped Loot to exclude certain items from quick looting:

(A) You can add an item to your Skipped Loot list via an item's context menu. Once added, you can remove that item from the list again via its context menu. (B) You can also add or remove items via the "Skip when Quick Looting" tick box in the Item Cyclopedia.

 

Choose Accepted Loot to only quick loot items that you have added to your accepted loot list. You can add an item to your Accepted Loot list or remove it via the item's context menu, similar to how it works with the Skipped Loot list.

You can also remove an item on the right-hand side of the Manage Loot Containers dialog by clicking the X-button.

 

You can add up to 500 items to both your skipped loot list and your accepted loot list.
 

How to manage and sort your loot conveniently:

The Manage Containers dialog allows you to assign categories to your containers to automatically sort quick-looted items if you have Premium status.

To assign a loot categoy, press the crosshairs button next to it and click on the container of your choice. Done!

From now on, quick-looted items of this category will be automatically put into that container.

To remove a loot category from a container, simply press the X button next to the category in the Manage Containers dialog.

You can assign multiple categories to the same loot container.

If you hover over the small bag icon in the lower right corner of a container that has at least one category assigned to it, these categories will be displayed.

Items that belong to categories which you have not assigned to a specific container, will be quick looted into the Unassigned Loot container.

Per default, this is your main container, the one you have equipped in the body slot. You can also select a different container for unassigned loot via the Manage Loot Containers dialog.

In the Options menu under Misc > Gameplay, there are two options that can help to organise items obtained from NPC traders or the stash:

If you enable Auto-Sort Purchases and Auto-Sort Stash into Containers, any purchased goods and items retrieved from the stash will be automatically placed into containers based on your pre-set filters.

Bought and retrieved potions will be placed into the caregory "Potions" while quick-looted potions will be placed into "Looted Potions".

gamenews.headline: Find Person on Optional PvP
gamenews.message:
Decide who can locate your character with the Find Person spell "exiva" on Optional PvP worlds.
 

Click on this icon above your chat console to open the Exiva Options dialog.

 

Per default, only party and guild members are allowed to use the Find Person spell on you.

 

This dialog allows you to customise your settings for the Find Person spell further.

You can allow it for all characters, you can allow it for pre-defined groups and you can also set up whitelists to allow the spell for specific characters or guilds.

 

Please note: if your guild participates in a guild war, all members of your guild, as well as the enemy guild will be able to use the Find Person spell on your character, regardless of your settings.

To add characters to your whitelist, you can either enter their names via the text field in the dialog window (A) or you can directly add single character names via the context menu in your VIP list (B).

 

 

You can even set a hotkey via the hotkey menu to toggle between the option "Allow all characters to use Exiva on me" and your previous setting for the spell:

 

If you use the spell on a character whom you are not allowed to locate, you will be notified in your server log.

The regular amount of mana will still be consumed when casting the spell.

If someone uses the spell on you but is not allowed to locate you, a quick glow of the Exiva Options icon will inform you about the attempt.

gamenews.headline: Recovery TAN
gamenews.message:
Add your mobile phone number to your registration to be able to change your registered email address instantly whenever you order a new recovery key.
 

If you add a valid mobile phone number to your registration, you will receive a recovery TAN via SMS text message whenever you order a new recovery key.
  • If you add a valid mobile phone number to your registration, you will receive a recovery TAN via SMS text message whenever you order a new recovery key.
  • The recovery TAN can be used to change the email address of an account instantly. A recovery TAN is only valid for 24 hours and can only be used once.

How to add a mobile phone number to your registration:

Click on your account page to open your account management.

Use the navigation bar or scroll down to go to the section Registration 
and click Edit to open the Change Registration Data interface.

 

Enter a valid mobile phone number in the respective line. 

You also need to enter your password before you can click Submit to confirm the request to change your registration data.

 

Within the next few minutes, you should receive a verificaction TAN via SMS on your mobile phone.

This verification TAN will only be valid for 15 minutes.

(1) Enter this TAN on the following page of the Change Registration Data interface.

 

(2) Click on Submit to verify your mobile phone number.

You can confirm your registration change after a waiting period of 30 days has passed. Please note that you need to verify your mobile phone number to be able to finalise the change.

 If you do not receive a verificaction TAN via SMS, you can request a new one.

(1) Open your registration data in your account management and request a new verification TAN.

(2) Click Send SMS on the next page.

gamenews.headline: Cyclopedia Map
gamenews.message:
The Cyclopedia Map is a world map of Tibia.
Discover areas to gradually unlock interesting info and details about the world.
 

You can open the Cyclopedia Map directly by clicking on the respective button next to the minimap.

 

 

Your character's current position is marked with a red pin on the map. This position is centered when you open the Cyclopedia map.

Use your mouse cursor to drag and drop the map in order to move it around. To zoom in and out of the map, hover your mouse cursor over the map and scroll the mouse wheel. Using the mouse wheel in combination with the SHIFT key changes the current floor.

If you want to center the map back to your character's current position, click the middle of the compass rose.

You can also use the navigation slider to switch the map to upper or lower floors.

  Hover your mouse cursor over the slider and scroll your mouse wheel up or down to switch floors.
A click on the blue or red section of the slider will show the map of the floor above or below you.
You can also drag and drop the slider to the map floor you would like to see.

Choose your preferred view of the map and the filter marks you would like to see displayed on the map.

The Cyclopedia Map is subdivided in different areas and subareas.

Click on the name of an area or subarea to select and highlight it on the map.


You can use the Cyclopdia Map to navigate your character.
SHIFT+Left-click in your Cyclopedia Map and your character starts walking to the desired position as long as the destination is reachable, within range and on the same layer.

Discover subareas!

1) Select a subarea.
2) Click the respective button to start discovering.

 

Points of Interest will now be randomly placed in the selected subarea. You will have to find 7 of them in order to discover the subarea completely.

 

If you have trouble finding enough of them, you can click the button Reset Points of Interest. All points will be randomly placed again and you can start over. Please note, though, that you will lose your current discovery progress of the subarea in question if you reset Points of Interest.

Once you have fully discovered enough subareas, you will unlock new useful features of the Cyclopedia Map:

Fully discovered at least 30% of all subareas of an area: locations of NPCs within that respective area can be shown on the map.

Fully discovered at least 70%: passages to subareas on other floor and teleports are displayed as stair symbols on the map.

Fully discovered all subareas of an area: creatures that occur in those subareas are listed when you click on a subarea's name or on a passages symbol that leads to this subarea. Creatures for which the Bestiary entry has not yet been unlocked are displayed as a silhouette.

In addition, a player who has completed an area will be notified whenever a raid is about to take place in that area within the next hour.

Visit to NPC Charos in the Adventurers' Guild to find out more about a special outfit you can unlock through discovering the Tibian world.

gamenews.headline: Supply Stash
gamenews.message:
The Supply Stash is a storage container in your depot locker into which premium players can stow stackable items.
 

In order to access the Supply Stash you need to stand on a glowing switch and open your locker.

 

Stow items in the Supply Stash

There are different ways to stow items in the Supply Stash:

Drag & drop an item on the Supply Stash symbol Select Stow or Stow all items of this type in the item's context menu. Drag & drop a container on the stash symbol. All stowable items in it will be moved to the stash.

 
 


 

 

 

 

 

 


 

Retrieve items from the Supply Stash

To retrieve items from the stash, click on the item and select or type the amount you want to retrieve.

 

Define loot containers to sort retrieved items

Depending on your loot container setup, retrieved items from the stash are automatically sorted into the respective containers in your inventory. If you want all retrieved items to be sent to only one container instead, you can assign a Stash Retrieve container.

 

Use predefined filters (1) to list only items of a designated category or use NPC filters (2) to display only items that can be sold to the selected NPC. If you are looking for a specific item, type its name into the search bar (3).

 

Stowed astral sources will be taken directly from your Supply Stash if you want to imbue your equipment at an imbuing shrine.

gamenews.headline: Auto Screenshots
gamenews.message:
Activate this feature to automatically take screenshots of important events.
 

The Auto Screenshots feature can be configured in the client options.

Activate Show Advanced Options to access the Misc category and the corresponding Screenshots subcategory.

 

Choose if you want your whole client interface to be included in the screenshots or if you only want to capture the game window.

 

You can select different ingame events that will trigger an automatic screenshot.
Hover over the  button with your mouse cursor to learn more about each event.

 

Your local screenshots folder can be accessed via the client.

 

All screenshots are named after a certain pattern:

date, time, character name, event name, backlog number.

Assign a hotkey in the general hotkeys section to trigger the screenshots feature manually.

gamenews.headline: VIP List
gamenews.message:
The VIP list helps you to keep track of your friends and enemies.
 

Open VIP list: Press or click the VIP list button to open the VIP list in your sidebar.

 

Add VIP

Enter a character's name to create the corresponding entry in your VIP list.

 

Edit VIP

VIP list entries can be edited. You can assign a special icon and enter a short description. Set a check mark if you want to receive an automatic message whenever the selected character logs into the game and tick the groups you want the character to be listed in.

 

VIP List Filters

You can sort your VIP list by certain criteria and clear it up by hiding offline characters and group names.

 

Add Groups

Keep your VIP list neat and tidy and categorise your entries in groups. Premium players can add up to 5 additional groups to their VIP list.

gamenews.headline: Improved Respawn Rate
gamenews.message:
All players of a game world can donate gold to areas in order to activate a temporary improved respawn rate bonus.
 

 

Click on the map icon to open your Cyclopedia Map.

 

 

 

Select the area for which you want to make a donation.

On the left side you can see the current amount of gold donated for your selected area.

Enter the amount of gold you want to donate and click the "Donate" button in order to raise the gold donations of the respective area.

Hover your mouse over "Improved Respawn Rate" to see a donation overview of all areas.

The area with the highest amount of gold donations is granted the respawn bonus on a daily basis.

Furthermore, each day, one randomly drawn area receives that bonus as well.

 

Areas and subareas with a next to their name have an improved respawn rate bonus running.
The improved respawn rate bonus of an area is active for one server save cycle. Afterwards, that area cannot receive another bonus for at least 24 hours.

 

 

 

In case you are not sure to which area your hunting ground belongs, you can check the navigation tab of the Cyclopedia Map.

It displays the name of the area in which you are currently standing.

gamenews.headline: Colourised Loot Value
gamenews.message:
Based on their gold value, items are highlighted with a coloured frame.
 

This allows to identify the approximate value of the item at a glance.

The colour depends on the loot value, which can be determined in the Items section of the Cyclopedia, either using the NPC buy value, the average Market price or your own preferred value.

Each colour represents a certain gold value range:

  • No frame means a gold value has yet to be defined in the Cyclopedia or equals 0.
  • Grey frame means a gold value of 1 - 999.
  • Green frame means a gold value of 1,000 - 9,999.
  • Blue frame means a gold value of 10,000 - 99,999.
  • Purple frame means a gold value of 100,000 - 999,999.
  • Yellow frame means a gold value of 1,000,000+.

 

According to this colour pattern, the individual items in every loot message are also highlighted in the respective colour.

 

In case you prefer a rather subtle coloured hint in the upper left corner instead of the frames or do not want to use see value colours at all, you can change it in the client's Interface options.

gamenews.headline: Party List
gamenews.message:
The party list is a Premium feature which shows all party members and their summons.
When they are nearby, their health points and mana will be displayed as well.

Click the party list button in your sidebar:

 

Party list filters allow you to show or hide members of six different groups:
players, knights, paladins, druids, sorcerers and summons.

 

You can also sort your party members by certain criteria.

 

Right-click on it to open the context menu with further options.

gamenews.headline: Depot Search
gamenews.message:
The depot search allows you to search your locker for items by name.

You do not need to type the full name to get results.

 

Tick the box "Show Locker only" if you only want to see items that you own.

 

After clicking on "Show search result." at the bottom right,
you can see whether the items are located in the depot, stash or inbox.

 

You can retrieve all items at once by clicking "Retrieve displayed Items"
or you can retrieve a single item with drag-and-drop.

With the summer update 2022, the depot search has received a filter option, in which you can select trader NPCs like Rashid or the Djinns, for example.

gamenews.headline: Hunting Tasks
gamenews.message:
Create a hunting task to gain rewards by killing a certain amount of a creature!
 

Press to open the prey dialog. Select the right tab "Hunting Tasks" at the top.

 

 

(1) You can also click the prey button to open the prey window in your sidebar.

(2) Left-click in the prey window under "Hunting Tasks" to open the prey dialog.

Select the creature to hunt or click here if you want to reroll the monsters to choose from:

 

The gold price for a list reroll depends on your character level.

 

 

Choose the amount of creatures you want to kill. The higher amount is only available once the creature's Bestiary entry has been completed.

 

 

Once you have selected the creature you wish to hunt, click here to start the hunting task.

 

If you are looking for a specific monster, you can use two Prey Wildcards to directly select the prey of your choice.

 

 

Use a Prey Wildcard to get higher rewards. While higher rewards are selected, you will get a chance to win additional Hunting Task Points.
Prey Wildcards can be purchased for Tibia Coins in the Store or can be obtained at the reward shrine.

 


The prey window shows your current hunted creature(s) and the amount that needs to be slain to fulfill the task.
Hover over your prey for a tooltip with details.

 


 

Once you have killed the required amount of monsters, click here to receive Hunting Task Points.

 

Hunting Task Points can be exchanged for an outfit, a mount and items by talking to the NPC Walter Jaeger in Thais.

 

You can create up to three hunting tasks simultaneously.
All players can use the first hunting task slot, Premium players can also use the second slot. Additional hunting task slots can be unlocked permanently by purchasing them for Tibia Coins in the Store.

gamenews.headline: Team Finder
gamenews.message:
Use the Team Finder to quickly and easily organise a hunt or find a group to play with.
 

Organise an Activity

Go to the Assemble Team tab in the Social dialog.

 

Choose the settings which reflect what kind of team members you are looking for.

 

By clicking on the shield icon, you can set the level range which allows sharing XP between the lowest level player and the highest level player, with your level being in the middle.

 

Click on to create your notice, which also opens a chat channel.

You can then either accept, invite or reject players who want to join. Inviting them adds them to the team channel, giving you a chance to talk to them before either accepting or rejecting them.

 

Look for a Team

Go to the Join Team tab in the Social dialog.

 

Choose the settings which reflect what kind of team you are looking for.

 

Once you have found a team you would like to join, select Join Team.

 

You will be notified once you have been accepted, invited or rejected. In case you are accepted or invited to the team, you will automatically join the team channel.

gamenews.headline: Client Settings and Minimap Export and Import
gamenews.message:
Use the export and import function to easily backup your client settings and minimap.
 

Under Help in the options menu you can find the buttons Export All Options, which exports your settings (including hotkeys) and action bars, as well as Export Minimap, which lets you export your current minimap.

 

Import Options/Minimap allows you to import both options and minimap after export.

gamenews.headline: Character Auctions
gamenews.message:
Character auctions allow you to sell your own characters or acquire other players' characters.
 

How to auction a character

On the bottom of the Store is a button that will open a dialog in which you can set up an auction to sell the character with which you are logged in.

 

Requirements

On the first page, you can check if all required conditions to sell this character are fulfilled. If you only see green checkmarks, you may click on Next.

Configure Auction

On the next page, the auction can be individualised, with several options to do so:

 

  Set the starting price of the auction. It has to be at least 57 Tibia Coins.

  Choose at which day and time the auction should end. Note that your local time is displayed there. The length of the auction must be between one and 29 days from the server save following the set-up of the auction.

  Select up to 4 of your rarest and most valuable items to be prominently displayed in the Char Bazaar.

  Select up to 5 of your best skills, your greatest achievements or other outstanding features of your character to be prominently displayed in the Char Bazaar.

All other relevant information about your character will be displayed in the Char Bazaar's auction details.

Confirm Auction

Finally on the last page, you can recheck your auction set-up. Read everything carefully.

If you have selected everything correctly and you are sure that you want to put up this character for auction, Confirm your choice. Go back to a Previous page to change your current set up. If you have changed your mind and do not want to sell this character any longer, simply Cancel this set-up.

Once the auction has been set up, you can no longer access the character to change it in any way, as you will be logged out and can no longer log on your character. If you want to cancel the auction, you have to use the account management on the website.

Further info

The auction itself will be hosted on the Tibia website in the section Char Bazaar.

For more information on the auctioning process, please take a look at the FAQ.

How to bid on a character

Bids are submitted on the Tibia website in the section Char Bazaar. Every relevant character detail is visible in the auction details. In this section you can not only bid on characters, but also watch auctions you are particularly interested in or see auctions which have ended in the last 30 days.

If you want to bid for a character, you can submit a bid limit, which has to be at least as high as the minimum bid or higher than the current bid, in case somebody has already bid on the character. Even though your bid limit may be much higher than the minimum or current bid, you only bid as much as you need in order to have the highest bid.

 

Once you have clicked on Submit Bid, read carefully before finally confirming your bid.

Once the auction has ended and you hold the highest bid, the price will be paid automatically if you have sufficient funds. If you lack the necessary funds, you have 7 days to pay the selling price. When paid, the character will appear in your character list after the next server save.

Further info

For more information on the bidding process, please take a look at the FAQ.

gamenews.headline: Tibiadrome
gamenews.message:
The Tibiadrome allows players to prove their combat skills in arena fights against creatures which become progressively harder. A variety of rewards await players who are successful in combat.
 

Tibiadromes can be found in Ankrahmun, Edron, Kazordoon, Rathleton, and Thais. Any player who has reached at least level 50 can enter the arena. At most, five players can enter at the same time. Once a player has left the arena, they have to wait 60 minutes before they can enter again.

Levels

Your starting level signifies on which wave you will begin when entering a fight. Each player starts on wave 1. Each wave lasts a maximum of 120 seconds, in which all the monsters have to be killed to advance to the next wave. Once you have beaten a wave, your drome level and starting level will be raised by one. If you are entering as a group, the lowest starting level of any participant will determine on which wave you start. Once a rotation which lasts two weeks is over, the drome level of all players will be reset to zero and their starting level will be reduced by five.

Difficulty scaling

The difficulty of a fight in the Tibiadrome scales via group size and current wave level. The more players participate in the fight, the more creatures spawn in a wave, and the higher the wave level, the stronger the creatures are.

Combat modifiers

A number of combat modifiers which trigger certain effects pose an additional challenge. At the beginning of a rotation, two modifiers are randomly selected which are the same across all game worlds and are active in all waves during this period. The modifiers are:

  • Somersault: All melee monsters have a 15% chance to teleport to the furthest player.
  • Going Down With Me: Upon death, monsters trigger an AoE that hits the lasthitter and all players around him for 25% of their current hp.
  • Exploding Corpses: Monsters explode in an AoE upon death, hitting all players around them for 40% of their current hp.
  • That Escalated Quickly: Monsters that drop below 25% increase their power as if they were 5 wave levels higher.
  • The Floor is Lava: Every 15 seconds 100 random fields will be marked. After 3 seconds they deal damage equal to 60% of the current hp of players standing on them.
  • Beam me Up!: Every 15 seconds 100 random fields will be marked. After 3 seconds all players on them will be teleported to a random position in the arena.
  • Tanked Up: Every 15 seconds 100 random fields will be marked. After 3 seconds all players on them will be superdrunk for 10 seconds.
  • Sown Sorrow: Every 20/17/14/11/8 seconds, depending on the number of participants, a seed will spawn. If no player steps on it within 6 seconds it will explode and fear all players for 2 seconds.
  • Bad Roots: Every 20/17/14/11/8 seconds, depending on the number of participants, a seed will spawn. If no player steps on it within 6 seconds it will explode and root all players for 3 seconds.

Special conditions

Since the Tibiadrome is a special environment, certain rules outside of it do not apply here. There is no death penalty, and mana, life and spirit potions, as well as runes, bolts, and arrows will not be consumed when used. There is no stamina drain and skill or level progression inside the Tibiadrome, and spells which cost soul points are deactivated.

Rewards

Besides a new highscore category, there is also a leaderboard on the website showing the standing of the participants in the current rotation. Players who have beaten at least one wave in the rotation will receive drome points after it has ended, which can be exchanged for decorative items, cosmetics, or a drome cube containing a powerful potion.

 

The players ranking among the top 20 also receive a certain amount of randomly selected powerful potions after a rotation, depending on how well they fared. Additionally, a certain amount of potions equal to 20% of the remaining participants (but not more than 50 in total) will be raffled among these participants. Those who have made the top 5 in a rotation will also receive a temporary title which will last until the next rotation ends.

gamenews.headline: Mount and Outfit Presets
gamenews.message:
The Customise Character dialog allows for the creation of presets with which you can quickly change your appearance.
 

Right-click on your character and choose Customise Character.

 

To create a new preset, click on the radio button next to Preset and then on New under Manage Presets. The new preset will appear in the list on the right. The colours of the outfit, the mount, and the familiar will be saved.

 

If you change your appearance and click on Save, the selected preset will be overwritten with the new configuration.

 

By clicking Copy (colours) when selecting outfits or colourisable mounts, the colour of your outfit or mount will be copied to clipboard. If you selected an outfit, you can then use Paste (colours) when selecting a colourisable mount to transfer the colours to it, and vice versa. Copy (all) copies the information about the outfit, the colours, the mount, and the familiar to clipboard. You can share this data with others who, after copying it to clipboard, can use Paste (all) to get your configuration.

gamenews.headline: Exaltation Forge
gamenews.message:
The Exaltation Forge allows players to upgrade weapons, armour, and helmets with powerful effects. Items can be increased in tiers, with the maximum number of tiers for an item being limited by its classification into one of four groups.

 

The Exaltation Forge lies north of the Adventurers' Guild.

 

Influenced Creatures

 

In order to make use of the forge, resources are required. The first one is dust. In order to get dust, which is non-tradable, players have to kill influenced monsters.

 

These creatures have a low chance to spawn in place of a regular monster and are stronger versions of regular monsters. The higher the number below their name, the stronger they are, and the higher the potential to yield more dust.

 

Fiendish Creatures

 

Fiendish monsters are even stronger than influenced monsters. They also give more dust, as well as a new tradable resource called slivers.

 

Fiendish monsters are much rarer than influenced monsters. The spell Find Fiend indicates the direction to the nearest fiendish creature.

 

Dust Limit and Conversion

 

A player can only carry 100 dust at first, but this limit can be increased to a maximum of 225 by spending dust.

 

Dust can also be converted into slivers, and slivers can be converted into exalted cores.

 

 

Effects

Upgrading an item through the Exaltation Forge provides it with the following effects:

  • Onslaught (for weapons): An attack may deal 60% bonus damage, which is additive to critical hits.
  • Ruse (for armour): Provides a chance of completely avoiding damage from an attack.
  • Momentum (for helmets): Grants a chance every two seconds to reduce all existing spell cooldowns by two seconds if the battle sign is present. This affects individual spell cooldown and the secondary group cooldown, but not the primary group cooldown.

A higher tier increases the trigger chance of these effects.

 

Fusion

 

Two of the same item need to be fused, in addition to a sum of gold (higher tiers demand higher prices), and 100 dust.

Success of a fusion is not guaranteed – there is a possibility that the second item will be either reduced by one tier, or, in case it was a tier 0 item, it will be destroyed. Using exalted cores, the success of the operation can be increased, however, and the risk of losing a tier gets reduced, should the fusion fail.

 

Transfer

 

A a tier can be transferred from another item of the same classification. The target item, which is to receive the tier, has to be tier 0, while the source item, from which the tier is transferred, has to be at least tier 2. This process requires 100 dust, one exalted core, and a sum of gold.

The transfer is guaranteed to succeed. The target item receives the source item's tier by a reduction of one tier, while the source item itself will be destroyed during the transfer.

gamenews.headline: Tibia Observer App
gamenews.message:
The Tibia Observer is a notification app that will support you in your Tibia activities. You can set up in-app and push notifications to keep yourself informed about things which matter to you.

The Tibia Observer app is available for download in the Google Play store and in the App store. 
It provides the following useful information and neat features:

  • Useful Char Info: Is your character still online training? Have you collected your daily reward? Is your stamina full? And what is today's boosted creature and bossted boss? Tibia Observer's dashboard shows it all at a glance.
  • Raids: Let yourself be notified about raid announcements from the Cyclopedia map if you have unlocked the respective area.
  • Events: The app can remind you about upcoming boost events such as double XP/skill, as well as world events.
  • Char Bazaar: Create a search for characters you are interested in and receive a notification once a fitting auction is up.
  • Offline Training: Optimise your offline training by staying notified about your characters training time pool.
  • Mini World Changes: Get informed about active mini world changes on server save.
  • Houses: The Tibia Observer can let you know when your dream house is up for auction.
  • News and Forum: Stay up to date on latest news, replies in one of your own threads and follow the CM tracker.

Tibia Observer is safe to use.
No password or other sensitive data is needed and stored on your smartphone.
More information on the app can also be found in the respective FAQs.

gamenews.headline: Bosstiary
gamenews.message:
Check which bosses you have killed and how often, and earn cool benefits for making progress.
 

You can access the Bosstiary via the respective tab in the Tibia Cyclopedia.

 

The first kill of a boss opens up the respective entry in the Bosstiary.
A kill only counts towards your progress if your particaption was high enough.
Depending on how often a boss can be killed within a certain amount of time,
it falls into one of three categories: Bane, Archfoe or Nemesis.

There are three progress levels you can unlock for each boss:

Prowess allows you to assign this boss to a boss slot which gives you an equipment loot bonus of 25% for this boss.
Expertise allows you to display this boss on a Podium of Vigour in your house or guildhall.
Mastery grants you an additional 25% equipment loot bonus when this boss is assigned to a boss slot.


You also receive boss points for unlocking a new progress level. By accumulating boss points you can gradually increase the equipment loot bonus of the boss slot.

Also, a second boss slot will be unlocked once you reach 1500 boss points.

The Bosstiary Tracker allows you to track your progress with bosses that you have defeated at least once. You can select the bosses you want to track via the Bosstiary.

The tracker also shows the cooldown of bosses: A white hourglass indicates an expired cooldown. A red hourglass indicates a cooldown that is still running. Hovering over the symbol shows the full cooldown time.


The Daily Boosted Boss ties in with Bosstiary. With every server save, a randomly drawn boss of the Archfoe category contains more equipment loot.
Also, one kill of this boss counts as three for your Bosstiary.

  

Making progress in the Bosstiary will also bestow temporary and permanent titles on your character.
Moreover, there is a highscore for "Boss Points".

gamenews.headline: Wheel of Destiny
gamenews.message:
The Wheel of Destiny enables you to further specialise your character based on your needs and playstyle as you level up.

The Wheel of Destiny offers something to look forward to for all promoted Premium characters above level 50.

You will gain promotion points which you can use to unlock various benefits ranging from small perks all the way up to new powerful spells and abilities depending on your vocation.

You can spend and remove points for free!

Whenever you have promotion points to spend, simply open the Wheel of Destiny and spend your points. You can do this any time. To remove or reset already invested points you have to be in a temple, though.

Perks

The Wheel of Destiny is divided into four domains. Each domain contains nine slices. So in total, there are 36 slices which you can fill with points to improve your character.

 

  • Dedication Perks have small effects. They gradually increase existing characteristics, e.g. your HP or your mana. Every promotion point invested into a Dedication Perk raises the bonus in question a bit till you have assigned the maximum number of points possible for this slice.
  • Conviction Perks have medium to large effects. They augment existing spells, grant vocation-specific passive abilities or generally useful bonuses, e.g. elemental resistance. You unlock a Conviction Perk once you have filled the respective slice to the max. Most Conviction Perks can be found more than once within the Wheel of Destiny. When they are unlocked, their effects add up.
                   
  • Revelation Perks have powerful effects. They grant new spells or strong passive effects with considerable impact. There are four Revelation Perks and each of them is assigned to one of the four domains of the wheel. You unlock a Revelation Perk once you have spent enough promotion points in the respective domain. Spending more points in the same domain will unlock the more powerful stages two and three of this Revelation Perk.

The Wheel of Destiny Presets allow you to switch between various wheel setups while you are in the temple. Presets can also be imported and exported. This means you can also share your setups with friends or transfer them to a different character.

The Wheel of Destiny Planner on the website allows you to select a vocation and freely distribute points. It also displays how many Promotion Points are required for your current specification and you will also be able to import and export your ingame setups. You can also set a limit for the points when using Planner.

gamenews.headline: Bug Reporting
gamenews.message:
You found a bug in Tibia and want to report it? Here is how:

1) If you find a bug in Tibia, you can report by using the key combination Ctrl+Z. 
This opens a special client dialog to report . It can also be opened via the context menu entry "Report Coordinate".

2) Select a fitting category for your bug report:

  • Typo
  • Technical
  • If you are unsure, select "Other"
  • If you want to report a map bug or an NPC bug, please check the report steps provided further below.

3) Describe the issue you encountered.

  • Include a step by step explanation as to how to reproduce the bug.
  • Make it as detailed as necessary and as short as possible.
  • Focus on important information. Leave out anything which is not crucial to understand the problem.
Bug reports automatically include your character name as well as the coordinates of the map field on which your character stood when submitting the bug. You do not need to provide this information in your report.

4) Click on "Send" to submit your bug report.
The submission of your bug report will be confirmed with the message "Comment sent" in your game window and server log.

Map Bugs

  • To report map bugs, right-click on the map field in question.
  • Select the entry "Report Coordinate" from the context menu.
    • The coordinate you clicked on will be sent automatically with your report.
  • Describe the map bug.

NPC Chat Bugs

  • To report mistakes in NPC chats, right-click on the NPC text in question.
  • Select the context menu entry "Report Message".
    • The NPC's name and line will then be sent automatically with your report.
  • Quote the typo or mistake.

General Info

To be able to report bugs, your account must have accumulated at least 30 loyalty points.

Each account can submit up to 5 bug reports per day.

An account can be blocked from submitting bug reports, e.g. in case of abusing the bug report function.

The bug report function is reserved exclusively for bugs, do not use it to report rule violations or illegal names!


Types of Bug
Map Bug:

If you see broken graphics, blue pixels, wrong automap colours, broken ground textures or strange looking wall parts, you have most likely found a map bug. 
 
Typo Bug:
 You are talking to an NPC or read a dusty old parchment and some of the words do not make any sense? Congratulations, your sharp eyes have spotted a typo. 
 
Technical Bug:
 An NPC is not working properly, e.g. refuses to trade or denies you access to a quest even though you fulfil the requirements? Select "Technical" in the bug report dialog to inform us about such issues.
The same goes for dead ends or loop holes in quests or world events. 
 
Other Bugs:
 In case you have stumbled upon an issue that does not fit the above mentioned bugs or if you are unsure, select "Other" in the bug report dialog.
 
Client Crash:
 Besides bugs in game, you might experience occasional client crashes during the test server. Usually, a crash report window will open once you have started the client again. Please describe the situation you were in when the crash occurred or if the usage of a specific client feature can provoke such crash. Sending the crash report is very important since it provides us with valuable insights about the cause.
